data.title: Library of Accessible Media for Pennsylvanians
data.meta_description: LAMP circulates over 1.5 million titles in accessible formats like digital & braille, large print and audio described DVD’s to Pennsylvanians.
data.text:
The Patron Engagement Section of the National Library Service is offering a monthly program that will focus on using the NLS Braille eReaders. This session will be about using your NLS Braille eReader to read BARD Mobile books. This is the first of a two-part program for August and September. The program will begin at 7 p.m. eastern time with a brief demonstration. The rest of the hour will be spent answering patron questions about any aspect of the Zoomax or HumanWare Braille eReaders. You may access the program by going to: https://loc.zoomgov.com/j/1608951162?pwd=cMmBfH2ZFcaXyRVAOQXnmt4RX9Ckvx.1

Please join us for a described audio presentation of A Haunting in Venice. (Rated PG-13)

“Now retired and living in self-imposed exile in the world’s most glamorous city, Poirot reluctantly attends a seance at a decaying, haunted palazzo. He soon gets thrust into a sinister world of shadows and secrets when one of the guests is murdered.”

Popcorn and drinks will be provided.

Registration is not required, but is suggested.

You can RSVP or request more information by contacting the library.

Email address: info@mylamp.org

Phone: 800-242-0586
